meanings.definition: To dance energetically to popular music.
meanings.sent1: She boogied on the dance floor all night long.
meanings.sent2: The kids boogied to their favorite song at the party.
meanings.sent3: The penguin boogied to the beat of the music, waddling back and forth.
meanings.sent4: The leaves boogied in the wind, swirling and twirling in a dance of their own.
meanings.sent5: His feet boogied with such enthusiasm that everyone couldn't help but join in.

meanings.sent1: He boogied down the street to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel boogied across the yard to hide its acorn.
meanings.sent3: The cat boogied away from the dog, trying to escape the chase.
meanings.sent4: The cars boogied along the highway, rushing to their destinations.
meanings.sent5: The wind boogied through the trees, carrying the scent of pine with it.

meanings.sent1: She boogied out of the room when she heard her mom calling.
meanings.sent2: The thief boogied from the scene before anyone could catch him.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit boogied out of the garden, leaving a trail of carrots behind.
meanings.sent4: The ghost boogied through the walls, disappearing into the night.
meanings.sent5: The idea boogied from his mind as quickly as it had entered.
